Eclipse is bombing our several times a day with the "No More Handles" message 
as per the trace extract below. I have looked at various postings for similar 
problems and none seem to offer any kind of solution - They simply say you have 
run out of operating system handles. If nothing can be done about this and the 
only solution is to terminate the the eclipse JVM could someone please tell me, 
in simple terms what the shortage is,  so that I can look at correcting it or 
working around it.   

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Dec 31, 2003 19:28:15.482
!MESSAGE No more handles
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2358)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2262)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image.internal_new_GC(Image.java:1756)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC.<init>(GC.java:74)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.ToolItem.createDisabledImage
(ToolItem.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.ToolItem.updateImages(ToolItem.java:790)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.ToolItem.setEnabled(ToolItem.java:552)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.update
(ActionContributionItem.java:541)
	at org.eclipse.jface.action.ActionContributionItem.act

"No More Handles" means that an OS limit on concurrently open resources has 
been reached.  This should not happen, especially if you're using win2000, and 
as a user there isn't anything you can do about it at runtime.

So there are probably plug-ins that aren't freeing their resources when done 
with them (resources = Images + Fonts + GCs + Colors + Regions).  If you're 
using any non-eclipse plugins then I would suspect them first, since there have 
not been many reports of the base eclipse 2.1.1 running out of handles on 
win2000.

As is mentioned in bug 49471, I'm going to do some more resource leak looking 
in the 3.0M6 build.
